columns.text: In this problem, we're going to calculate the return on investment on the offered college saving programs, which requires an annual payment of $15,000 for six years and then grants $32,000 yearly for four years.

Let's begin by dissecting and projecting the future cash flows of the program. 

Studying the offered college program, we can pinpoint that the saving program will be in effect for a total of 10 years if the minimum payment is six years, and the return will last for four years.

Regarding the preceding steps, the following are the cash flows for the next ten years if the program is taken:

| Year | Cash flows ($)       |
|------|----------------------|
| 1    |            (15,000)  |
| 2    |            (15,000)  |
| 3    |            (15,000)  |
| 4    |            (15,000)  |
| 5    |            (15,000)  |
| 6    |            (15,000)  |
| 7    |              32,000  |
| 8    |              32,000  |
| 9    |              32,000  |
| 10   |              32,000  |
Next, to determine the return on the investment, we'll calculate the internal rate of return based on the projected cash flows for the next ten years as presented in the previous steps.

In this calculation, we will use the spreadsheet function known as IRR to determine the internal rate of return.

The IRR function in the spreadsheet calculates the rate of return in an investment based on the series of cash flows.

The following is the syntax of the IRR function in the spreadsheet.

$$\begin{aligned}
IRR&=(\text{values},\text{[guess]}) \\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

IRR, which denotes the internal rate of return\
values, which indicates the range of cells of the series of cash flows\
guess, which refers to the optional field used to achieve a close result to the value entered.

Let's now calculate the program's return on investment in the spreadsheet.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/a92fda49-ab9d-4d01-a799-15a117f7f44b-1644157481983239.png)

**As can be seen in our calculation, the return on investment on the program is 7.21%**
To summarize, after taking into account the program's expected future cash flows, the conclusion of our computation shows that the investment will yield a 7.21% return if the program is implemented.
